channel.title: JavaScript Weekly
channel.description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects

item.title: How V8 continues to get faster
item.description:
#526 ‚Äî February 19, 2021

Unsubscribe¬†¬†|¬†¬†Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Announcing Vite 2.0 ‚Äî Vite is a build tool aimed at giving you a faster development experience by providing a dev server with hot module replacement support, and Rollup- and esbuild-powered bundling and¬†building.

Evan You

V8's Super Fast super Property Access ‚Äî The first of two articles this week about how the V8 team are somehow making the already fast V8 JavaScript engine even faster for us. Using super, till now, was an unoptimized and slightly costly operation but now it‚Äôs almost on par with accessing normal¬†properties.

Marja H√∂ltt√§ (V8)

Frontity: Bringing React to WordPress ‚Äî Frontity Framework connects with WordPress seamlessly so you can focus on building your React front-end, without worrying about tooling and configuration. Its ease of use and extensibility make it a favorite when working with headless¬†WordPress.

Frontity sponsor

An Interview with Ryan Dahl, the Creator of Node.js and Deno ‚Äî Ryan created Node.js 11 years ago and in recent years has moved on to Deno where he‚Äôs attempting a new take at the same idea. This interview touches on Deno‚Äôs challenges and Ryan‚Äôs love of Rust and¬†Vim.

Evrone

V8's Route to Faster JavaScript Method Calls ‚Äî This gets very technical and fast, but it‚Äôs yet more of a look behind what the V8 team is up to. This work improves the performance of your Node and browser-facing code¬†alike.

Victor Gomes

Opal 1.1: A Ruby to JavaScript Compiler ‚Äî An interesting way to take Ruby code to the frontend by simply translating it into JavaScript. It‚Äôs been around for years but 1.1.0 is the first significant release in some¬†time.

Adam Beynon and Contributors

Quick Bits

  • NASA used Three.js to render a real-time simulation of this week's NASA rover landing on Mars üöÄ
  • The date-fns documentation site lets you play with the library in the browser console in a cute way and here's the code that makes it¬†work.
  • One of the Angular core team has written about how Angular strongly encourages best practices and the next natural step is for Angular 12 to enable 'strict mode' by¬†default.
  • Node.js has some security releases coming out next week ‚Äì one of the security issues involved is of 'critical'¬†severity. We will share these in next week's issue of Node¬†Weekly.
  • esbuild now supports Apple's M1 chip natively and is even faster.
  • The Colyseus open source Node-powered multiplayer game engine has been 'acquired' by Lucid Sight, a developer of popular licensed mobile games.

üíª Jobs

Senior/Lead React Developer (Remote) ‚Äî Join our talented team - thinking big, building world-class restaurant and guest experience management¬†products.

Eat App

Senior Web Developer (Node/ReactJS) - Remote ‚Äî Millions get inspired and plan adventures with our apps. To help us make komoot.com the place to go to plan outdoor adventures, we‚Äôre looking for a one of a kind Web Developer to join our¬†team.

Komoot

Find Your Next Job Through Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.

Hired

üìñ¬†Articles, Opinion & Tutorials

How to 'Listify' a JavaScript Array ‚Äî There‚Äôs a little more to making a human readable list from an array in JavaScript than you might think. There‚Äôs a bonus TypeScript version¬†too.

Kent C Dodds

Avoiding npm Substitution Attacks ‚Äî Recently there have been some high profile examples of supply chain attacks, such as where fake or eponymous packages are published, but you can reduce your attack surface by taking precautions and managing¬†dependencies.

Isaac Z. Schlueter

Introducing SPOTcon 2021! Get Your Free Early Bird Ticket Today ‚Äî Scout APM's digital event on performance and observability. Register before 2/28 and we'll donate $5 to OSS when you¬†attend.

Scout APM sponsor

Learn Snowpack: A High-Performance Frontend Build Tool ‚Äî We‚Äôve mentioned Snowpack a lot in the past year but it‚Äôs nice to see a third party introduction and¬†tutorial.

Jack Franklin

How to Publish an Angular, React, Svelte, or Vue App with Azure Static Web Apps ‚Äî A multi-step tutorial on deploying a modern JavaScript app to Azure Static Web Apps, Azure‚Äôs platform for building and deploying static apps from a GitHub¬†repository.

John Papa (Microsoft)

Serverless TypeScript: A Complete Setup for AWS SAM Lambdas ‚Äî A workflow for creating TypeScript-based AWS Lambda functions with AWS SAM that support testing, debugging, etc. and using shared layers to package¬†dependencies.

Andrey Novikov and Sergey Alexandrovich

The Ultimate Guide to Cardinality for Observability

Lightstep sponsor

How to Use WebSockets With Your Vue.js Projects ‚Äî Not a tutorial but two blobs of code to show you how a basic Vue.js frontend and a Node backend can communicate with¬†WebSockets.

Mastering JS

Web Frameworks: Why You Don't Always Need Them
Richard MacManus

How to Create a Shrinking Header on Scroll without JavaScript
H√•vard Brynjulfsen

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

a11y-dialog: Accessible, Lightweight Dialog Windows ‚Äî It can lean on the native dialog element, if you like, has WAI-ARIA support, and there‚Äôs a demo here. I like¬†it.

Hugo ‚ÄúKitty‚Äù Giraudel

Metascraper: A Library to Scrape Metadata from Web Content ‚Äî It uses things like Open Graph annotations, JSON+LD, and HTML metadata to get you things like author, title, description, and even an image related to the URLs of your¬†choice.

Microlink

fullPage.js: Create Fullscreen Scrolling Sites ‚Äî Available in Vue, React, and Angular flavors too. (GPL 3.0 licensed.) GitHub¬†repo.

√Ålvaro Trigo

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is the Future ‚Äî 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints and¬†console.log.

Wallaby.js sponsor

Neutralino 1.8: Portable, Lightweight Desktop App Framework ‚Äî Think something like Electron but rather than including a Chromium distribution with every app, it uses the platform‚Äôs built-in Web view component. Due to this, Neutralino boasts low memory use and small distribution size for apps. GitHub¬†repo.

Codezri

ExcellentExport.js: Export Table Data to Excel or CSV ‚Äî If your app/page has some data in HTML tables and you‚Äôd like to export it to CSV or XLSX without any server involvement, this could¬†help.

Jordi Burgos

OrgChart: A jQuery Plugin for Rendering Org Charts ‚Äî It‚Äôs not often we get to link to jQuery plugins anymore(!) but this is one that‚Äôs kept up to date. There are Vue, Angular, and React versions too but less frequently updated. Examples of¬†output.

Xuebin Dong

fast-check: Property Based Testing for JavaScript and TypeScript

Nicolas Dubien

disableautofill.js: Disable Form Auto-Fill and Auto-Complete Functions ‚Äî You need to be very careful about where you use things like this due to effect on assistive¬†tools.

Terry Lin

SVGJAR: An Easy Way to Add SVG Images to Ember Apps

Ivan Votti

üÜï Quick releases:

  • Node 15.9.0
  • ESLint 7.20.0
  • Print.js 1.6.0 ‚Äî Library to help printing from your web pages.
  • react-datepicker 3.5.0 ‚Äî Datepicker component for React.
  • Gutenberg 10.0 ‚Äî The block editor used by WordPress.
  • Riot.js 5.3.0 ‚Äî Simple and elegant component-based UI library.

item.title: Eich shares his full JavaScript story
item.description:
#525 ‚Äî February 12, 2021

Unsubscribe¬†¬†|¬†¬†Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

‚ñ∂¬†¬†JavaScript's Creator Brendan Eich Shares The Full Story of¬†JavaScript ‚Äî Lex Fridman is an AI researcher who‚Äôs becoming well known for high quality interviews with some of the greatest minds of our time and here he talks with Brendan Eich about his coding history, JavaScript‚Äôs full origin story, the browser wars, and¬†Brave.

Lex Fridman

Marko 5: eBay's UI Library Grows Up ‚Äî If you‚Äôve used eBay, you‚Äôve used Marko. It‚Äôs eBay‚Äôs open-source JavaScript UI framework and is celebrating its ninth birthday with a new major version. There‚Äôs a lot to like, but it‚Äôs obviously not React or Angular. Project¬†homepage.

Ryan Carniato

Locate Front-End Issues Like JavaScript or Network Errors Instantly ‚Äî Get proactively alerted on any client-side issues such as JavaScript and network errors, optimize the load time of your front-end resources, and detect any UI issues that affect critical user journeys. Try it free with Datadog¬†Synthetics.

Datadog sponsor

Remotion: Create Videos and Motion Graphics with React ‚Äî I'm no fan of video editing, but what if rather than creating videos in apps like Final Cut or AfterEffects we could just program them.. Here's a fantastic 90-second trailer showing off the idea, but Alex Anderson has also put together an 18-minute screencast showing off exactly how to make a video production of your own. v1.1 just dropped. GitHub¬†repo.

Jonny Burger

Mass Function Overloading: Why and How? ‚Äî Lea is rewriting Bliss to use ES modules and is pondering the implications for her API‚Äôs¬†design.

Lea Verou

Quick Bits

  • The first release candidate of TypeScript 4.2 is out.
  • React has now passed the 10 million downloads per day mark.
  • Ajv is a JSON schema validator and an OpenJS Foundation project. Here's a huge update on what's going on with it.

üíª Jobs

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) ‚Äî Join the most energizing community for developers and work on projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, and¬†more.

X-Team

Find Your Next Job Through Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.

Hired

üìñ¬†Articles, Opinion & Tutorials

Sharing Data Between CSS and JavaScript with Custom Properties ‚Äî How to use JavaScript to give CSS things it can‚Äôt access. For example, CSS can‚Äôt read pointer coordinates, but JavaScript¬†can.

Christian Heilmann

Generators in JavaScript and How to Use Them ‚Äî Not played around with generators (as introduced in ES6) yet? This is a pretty good¬†walkthrough.

Karim Elghamry

Faster CI/CD for All Your Software Projects Using Buildkite ‚Äî See how Shopify kept build times under 5 minutes while they scaled from 300 to 1800¬†engineers.

Buildkite sponsor

How to Generate a Presigned URL in Modular AWS SDK for JavaScript ‚Äî A very common use case for S3 is to have client side apps directly download or upload assets to/from it (e.g. photos, videos, large uploads). The way to give users privileged access to S3 objects or buckets without giving them full-on AWS credentials is to use signed URLs, as demonstrated¬†here.

Allan Zheng

Seven Interview Questions on JavaScript Closures ‚Äî You might want to revise A Simple Explanation of JavaScript Closures before you take these on ;-)

Dmitri Pavlutin

Accessing Hardware Devices on the Web: A Roundup of APIs ‚Äî Chrome tends to have more unique APIs for hardware access so take care if cross browser compatibility is necessary, but there are a lot of options nonetheless from the Gamepad API or getUserMedia to the Generic Sensor API or Web¬†NFC.

Fran√ßois Beaufort

How Ruby on Rails' Creator is Taking on JavaScript Frameworks with¬†Hotwire ‚Äî David Heinemeier Hansson holds strong views about Web development and JavaScript-heavy front-end frameworks isn't a part of his¬†approach.

Richard MacManus

Build Interactive Messaging with Stream, MML, Node, & React

Stream sponsor

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Syntax.fm Covers Deno ‚Äî The popular Syntax.fm Web development podcast turns its attention to Deno (the TypeScript-oriented, safety first, server side JavaScript runtime) with a thorough tour of its capabilities and¬†potential.

Syntax Podcast podcast

Clean Code Through Reactive Programming in Angular with RxJS
Paul Clavier

Getting Started with Apache Kafka in Node.js
Valeri Karpov

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

supported by

WebdriverIO v7 Released ‚Äî WebdriverIO is a popular browser and mobile automation testing framework for Node. v7 brings it over to TypeScript, improves its Google Lighthouse integration, and improves compiler tool integration. There‚Äôs even a brief video about the¬†release.

Christian Bromann

GoldenLayout: A Multi-Window Layout Manager for Webapps ‚Äî This project went open source five years ago (we covered it in issue 279!) but with this week‚Äôs 2.0 release has been rewritten in TypeScript, reworked (bye jQuery!), and now only supports modern browsers. Want some¬†demos?

Wolfram Hempel

Ember Table 3.0: Powerful Table Control for Ember Apps ‚Äî Another older library that‚Äôs been brought up to modern standards (though it has dropped Ember versions under 2.8). Always great to see this happening. GitHub¬†repo.

Addepar

Managing Your Tasks Shouldn't Be a Task ‚Äî "Clubhouse is like a fast and delightful version of Jira, a more purposeful version of Trello." - Current¬†User.

Clubhouse.io sponsor

Mineflayer 3.0: Let's Build Minecraft Bots in JavaScript ‚Äî Want to have some gaming fun but not ready to put down the code? There‚Äôs even a tutorial aimed at non-coders if you want to let the kids have a go. GitHub¬†repo.

Andrew Kelley

run-parallel 1.2: Run an Array of Functions in Parallel ‚Äî Run an array of functions in¬†parallel.

Feross Aboukhadijeh

üÜï Quick releases:

  • Marked 2.0 ‚Äî Fast Markdown parser and compiler.
  • React Static 7.5.0 ‚Äî Progressive static site generator for React.
  • Lerna 4.0 ‚Äî Tool for managing projects with multiple packages.
  • Mocha 8.3.0 ‚Äî Test framework for Node.js and the browser.
  • Deno 1.7.2 ‚Äî Server-side TypeScript runtime.

item.title: How GitHub keeps its new homepage fast
item.description:
#524 ‚Äî February 5, 2021

Unsubscribe¬†¬†|¬†¬†Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Making GitHub‚Äôs New Homepage Fast and Performant ‚Äî If you‚Äôre not logged in, GitHub‚Äôs new homepage is essentially a laundry list of GitHub‚Äôs features (with screenshots, videos, etc.) coupled with a live updating 3D globe of GitHub activity. This is a lot for a browser to handle at once, so they‚Äôve had to do a lot of work to keep it¬†fast.

Tobias Ahlin (GitHub)

Don't Use Functions As Callbacks Unless They're Designed for It ‚Äî A clever and nuanced point here. Callbacks can introduce added hidden complexity that can cause seemingly innocent code to break so it pays to be¬†careful.

Jake Archibald

Fast, Reliable Feature Management for the Modern Enterprise ‚Äî LaunchDarkly is a feature management platform that empowers teams to safely deliver & control software through feature flags. By separating code deployments from feature releases, we enable you to deploy faster, reduce risk, and iterate¬†continuously.

LaunchDarkly sponsor

npm 7 Now Generally Available ‚Äî It‚Äôs been in beta for some time but npm 7 is now ready for the big time. The new features and changes (which are mostly minor) were covered in last year‚Äôs presenting npm 7.0.0 post but include workspaces, automatically installing peer dependencies and an improved package lock file¬†format.

Brian Douglas

The V8 v8.9 Branch ‚Äî The latest branch of the V8 JavaScript engine has been created and will be in beta until Chrome 89‚Äôs eventual release. It‚Äôs a relatively small update, but top-level await comes to browser use cases and function calls with mismatched argument sizes will get a lot¬†faster.

Ingvar Stepanyan

Quick Bits

  • Homebrew 3.0 is out with Apple Silicon support.
  • There's a new VS Code release which lets you debug Node.js worker threads and also adds conditional exception breakpoints to the JS¬†debugger.
  • AWS Amplify has added support for Vue 3.
  • If you happen to have the 'Clubhouse' social audio app and you're quick enough, several well known JavaScript developers are getting together for a 'JavaScript Friday' chat at 10am PT (6pm GMT) today. More info¬†here.

üíª Jobs

Full-Stack Web Engineer ‚Äî As part of adidas, we engage millions of users each day - through our apps and on the web. Join our Web Team and support the maintenance of our website and tools to provide the best user¬†experience.

Runtastic

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) ‚Äî Join the most energizing community for developers and work on projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, and¬†more.

X-Team

Find a Job Through Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.

Hired

üìñ¬†Articles, Opinion & Tutorials

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Using Vue 3 with Electron to Build a Desktop App ‚Äî A tightly edited 10-minute screencast that shows off the key parts in making a local file explorer with Vue and Electron without plodding through every single line of¬†code.

Coding with Justin

How JavaScript Can Now Be Executed in Oracle Database ‚Äî As of version 21c, released last month, Oracle Database can now execute JavaScript, powered by GraalVM. This post digs into the technicalities of how it¬†works.

Alina Yurenko (Oracle)

Access your Database from React Server Components with¬†Ease ‚Äî Query data from MySQL, PostgreSQL DBs in React Server Components with Prisma, a better ORM for JavaScript &¬†TypeScript.

Prisma sponsor

Dynamic Static Typing in TypeScript ‚Äî A look at some of TypeScript‚Äôs more advanced features including union types, conditional types, template literal types, and¬†generics.

Stefan Baumgartner

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Discussing Next Gen Bundlers with Jason Miller and Fred Schott ‚Äî A podcast chat with the maintainers of Snowpack and WMR about bundling and how ES Modules change the game for modern JavaScript development.¬†Educational!

The ShopTalk Show podcast

‚ñ∂¬†¬†What Is Gatsby.js, and Why Is It a Big Deal? ‚Äî If you‚Äôre interested in Gatsby, this is a good interview with Gatsby engineer Max¬†Stoiber.

Prismic

Buildkite Helps You Deliver Software Quickly and Securely at Any¬†Scale

Buildkite sponsor

Using the Web Serial API with RxJS for Two-Way Reactive Communication with Serial Hardware
Tane Piper

Lazy Loading Routes in Vue with webpack Dynamic Comments
Jorge Baumann

HTML Form Validation in Cypress
Gleb Bahmutov

Building Server-Side Rendering for React Apps on AWS Lambda
Roman Boiko

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Vuex 4.0 Released: State Management Mechanism for Vue 3 Apps ‚Äî Vuex now supports Vue 3 in its new 4.0 incarnation. Here‚Äôs the full 4.0 release¬†notes.

Vuex Community

autoComplete.js 8.3: A Simple Pure Vanilla Auto Completion Library ‚Äî Vanilla JavaScript, no dependencies, and there‚Äôs a live demo¬†here.

Tarek Raafat

eslint-config-auto: Automatically Configure ESLint Based on Project Dependencies ‚Äî ‚ÄúHaving got fed up of maintaining eslint configs on a range of projects, I‚Äôve put together a meta config that inspects the dependencies listed package.json and then automatically configures itself with the most appropriate¬†plugins..‚Äù

David J. Bradshaw

Wallaby‚Äôs Test Profiler Helped Us Make Jest Tests Run 5x Faster ‚Äî Wallaby‚Äôs Test Profiler allows you to quickly record a test‚Äôs CPU usage profile to analyze its runtime¬†performance.

Wallaby.js sponsor

redaxios: The Axios API, as an 800 Byte Fetch Wrapper ‚Äî If you love the Axios API but want it using the Fetch API behind the¬†scenes..

Jason Miller

v8go: Execute JavaScript from Go(lang) ‚Äî Lets you create V8 contexts and run code eval-style. If you happen to be a Go developer, check out our Go newsletter too :-)

Roger Chapman

Five React Native Libraries You Might Have Missed ‚Äî Some useful React Native libraries to be sure to check out for your next mobile app¬†project.

Fabian Lee

react-ultimate-resume: Your 21st Century Resume ‚Äî This is novel: a library which enables you to create an online resume to help you stand out from the crowd. Built by developers for developers with an eye on what tech recruiters allegedly¬†want.

WeLoveDevs

üÜï Quick releases:

  • Node 15.8.0
  • Karma 6.1 ‚Äî Test runner.
  • Highcharts 9.0 ‚Äî Popular charting framework.
  • Cypress 6.4.0 ‚Äî Testing system.
  • json5 2.2 ‚Äî Humanistic JSON superset.

item.title: undefined vs null in JavaScript
item.description:
#523 ‚Äî January 29, 2021

Unsubscribe¬†¬†|¬†¬†Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

TOAST UI Chart 4.0 Released ‚Äî A MIT licensed chart library equally suited for vanilla JavaScript, Vue or React use cases. It‚Äôs responsive, easy to theme, and now dependency free meaning it clocks in at just 67KB gzipped. It now supports live updating of charts across several chart types too. Want demos? Here‚Äôs lots of demos and the GitHub¬†repo.

NHN Corp

undefined vs. null Revisited ‚Äî Most languages include a concept of a ‚Äònon-value‚Äô (often called null or nil) but JavaScript has two in the form of undefined and null. Dr. Axel analyzes their differences and where and why they‚Äôre¬†used.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Combining React, GraphQL, NoSQL and Serverless ‚Äî Connect your React frontend to an automatically generated GraphQL data access API for your NoSQL DBaaS in < 5 minutes. Yep, that‚Äôs Apache Cassandra on DataStax Astra: the proven, globally distributed, highly available cloud database. Try our serverless beta. | No credit card, free to¬†5GB.

DataStax Astra sponsor

Deno 1.7 Released ‚Äî Node‚Äôs younger cousin comes boasting new features and improvements. A big update is that deno compile (which lets you compile complete JavaScript apps to a single executable) is more efficient with support for cross compilation and ~60% reduced compiled¬†size. ‚Üí Via our Deno newsletter.

Bartek Iwa≈Ñczuk and Luca Casonato

Cypress vs Selenium vs Playwright vs Puppeteer Speed Comparison ‚Äî If you‚Äôve got some browser automation to do, particularly around testing, you now have quite a few options, but how do they compare in terms of speed? Spoiler: Playwright comes out of it looking¬†good.

Giovanni Rago (Checkly)

10 Bad TypeScript Habits to Break This Year ‚Äî Unsurprisingly, given the title, this is very¬†opinionated.

Daniel Bartholomae

Quick Bits

  • A quick round up of features coming to ES2021 ‚Äì we'll be doing a bigger feature on this¬†soon.
  • WebRTC is now a W3C and IETF standard.
  • A month-by-month look back at what happened in 2020 with the Deno¬†project.
  • Node 15.7.0 has been released.
  • JavaScript benchmark results on the latest Android phones are embarrassing compared to iOS devices, says the creator of Ruby on Rails.

üíª Jobs

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) ‚Äî Join the most energizing community for developers and work on projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, and¬†more.

X-Team

Find Your Next Job Through Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.

Hired

üìñ¬†Articles, Opinion & Tutorials

A Walkthrough of Migrating MaxRozen.com from Gatsby to Next.js ‚Äî There‚Äôs no shortage of ‚Äúhow to use Next.js‚Äù or ‚Äúhow to use Gatsby‚Äù articles but moving between them is both trickier and less commonly¬†seen.

Max Rozen

Get Started with Modding Factorio using TypeScript ‚Äî Factorio is a popular factory building game (beware, I‚Äôm told it can be a huge timesuck) and it can be modded using Lua. Luckily, you can compile TypeScript to Lua so there are some neat modding opportunities for us. factorio-type-kit helps make it¬†possible.

Christopher Dieringer

Creating Custom RxJS Operators ‚Äî RxJS is a key part of Angular (though it can be used separately to it too) and it provides a powerful way to work with data using pipelines and operators. So what if you want to create an operator of your¬†own..?

Tane Piper

An Introduction to the Rollup.js Bundler ‚Äî Rollup is a popular ES module oriented module¬†bundler.

Craig Buckler

A Big List of HTTP Static Server One-Liners ‚Äî Want to spin up a quick HTTP server locally? There‚Äôs a lot of ways to do it and this list is updated on¬†occasion.

William Bowers

The Ultimate Guide to Cardinality for Observability

Lightstep sponsor

Rendering Colorful Twisted Spheres with Three.js ‚Äî Learn how to deform and color spheres to create an interesting animation with¬†Three.js.

Mario Carrillo

Getting Started with Netlify Functions for Angular ‚Äî A guide to the first steps of adding serverless functions to an Angular application using Netlify Functions (which itself is built on top of AWS¬†Lambda).

Tara Z. Manicsic (Netlify)

Using fetch with TypeScript
Kent C Dodds

Building a Range Slider with SVGs in Angular
Marcus Revaj

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

supported by

RunJS: A JavaScript 'Scratchpad' Desktop Tool ‚Äî Write and run JavaScript (or TypeScript!) instantly whether to learn, test, create screencasts or explanatory tweets, or just fiddling around generally. Available for macOS, Windows, and Linux. It‚Äôs seen a few releases since we first mentioned it over a year¬†ago.

Luke Haas

react-editor-js: Unofficial Editor.js Component for React ‚Äî editor.js is a block-based content editor and this makes it easier to use with React. Check out the CodeSandbox demo.

Jungwoo An

Fast and Reliable Feature Management for the Modern Enterprise ‚Äî Built for Engineering Teams. Easy Implementation. Designed for Enterprise Scale. Try LaunchDarkly for free¬†today.

LaunchDarkly sponsor

Source Map Visualization: Upload and View JavaScript/CSS Source Map Data ‚Äî You can upload your own source map file or load the example file to see how this¬†works.

Evan Wallace

CKEditor 5 v25.0.0 Released ‚Äî A very long-standing GPL-licensed (with commercial option) WYSIWYG HTML editor control (demos here) has introduced annotations (for collaborative editing) and improved formatting of large text¬†blocks.

Bartek Biedrzycki and Anna Tomanek

vue-easytable 2.0: A Flexible Vue 2.x Table Component ‚Äî The site has plenty of examples and it‚Äôs easy to get going. v2.0 is a complete rewrite from v1.0. GitHub¬†repo.

vue table ÁªÑ‰ª∂

Cheval 2.0: 'Copy to The Clipboard' using JavaScript Without Writing JS ‚Äî If you want to keep things really simple but offer a ‚Äúcopy to the clipboard‚Äù feature on your pages, this takes care of the whole thing once you‚Äôve added some classes to a couple of HTML¬†elements.

Ryan McQuen

post-me: Communicate with Web Workers and Other Windows ‚Äî A promise-based API for an app and its child workers or windows to expose methods and custom events to each¬†other.

Alessandro Genova

Scout APM - Leading Edge Performance Monitoring Starting at $39/Month ‚Äî Streamline troubleshooting with real-time alerts & tracing logic that ties issues to source code. Try free for 14¬†days.

Scout APM sponsor

vue-content-loader 2.0: SVG-based 'Loading Placeholder' Component ‚Äî A Vue port of Julian ƒÜwirko‚Äôs react-content-loader which is also¬†updated.

Kevin Hazy

üÜï Quick releases:

  • electron-store 7.0 ‚Äî Data persistence for Electron apps.
  • Sequelize 6.5.0 ‚Äî SQL ORM for Node.js.
  • Electron React Boilerplate 2.2
  • Dropbox SDK for JavaScript 9.0
  • GitHub.js 3.4 ‚Äî High level GitHub API wrapper for the¬†browser.
  • npm 7.5.0
  • billboard.js 2.2.0 ‚Äî Chart library based on D3.js.
